p: An independent-samples Kruskal-Wallis test did not reveal any differences between groups in the choice-RT task ( H = 1.81, p = 0.41) or in the Simon task ( H = 1.07, p = 0.59). The median for correct responses in the choice-RT task was 20 (out of 20), with a range of 17–20, and the average success was 99%. The median for correct responses in the Simon task was 18, with a range of 10–20, and the average success was 89%.
